modName: AjuntaPall316s Glass Armor using TnT Athena Body
summary: Semi-Transparent Re-texture and mesh files of the Glass Armor.  TnT Athena Body model.
descriptionHtml:
AjuntaPall316\'s Glass Armor

TO INSTALL:
Drag the \"DATA\" to the games installation directory.  ie: C:/Program Files/Steam/steamapps/common/skyrim
Overwrite where necessary.

To install the Optional Textures, drag that \"Data\" folder after installing the main one. Overwrite where necessary.

TO Uninstall: Delete the specific files out of your Data folder.


If you do not want transparent items don\'t copy the Meshes folder, just copy the Textures folder.  



Nude Mod not included.  Download nude mod of your preference.

Such as:

http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=3844 - By TnT (2pac4eva7, motseer, DorkDiva, Thor925)


Uses Athena bodies 1 (small) - 4 (large)
Also contains optional meshes for 5 (Heavy) and 6 (Voluptuous)

****Clipping issues should only occur when couching or when using body meshes 5 - 6 ****

This mod uses the Weight slider in the character creation screen.  Turned all the way left the female character will have small breasts,  all the way right she will
have large breasts.  If you only want large breasts: Go to the mesh folder (ie: C:/Program Files/Steam/steamapps/common/skyrim/Data/Meshes/Armor/Glass/f/)
delete the file called cuirass_0.nif, copy/rename cuirass_1.nif so the same file is both cuirass_0.nif and cuirass_1.nif.  You do need both files.

If you want medium sized breasts you need to use the slider, or the Medium only optional download.


Credit:

This mod uses the nude body model: TnT Athena - By TnT (2pac4eva7, motseer, DorkDiva, Thor925)

Download their mod here: http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=3844




FAQ:  Why didn\'t you make the Helmet, Gloves, Boots, etc. transparent?  A) Because it\'s not working. That\'s why.
      
     Can you make the male armor transparent too? A) I could, but I won\'t... because I won\'t use it and I don\'t mod things I wont use.

      Can you make them more/less transparent?  A) Again, I can but I won\'t. Now that the meshes are done, you can make them as transparent as you want to changing the alpha channels on the .dds files.  Look up a tutorial on alpha channels and give it a whirl.



Hope you enjoy.

AjuntaPall316
author: AjuntaPall316
